mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Jane C. Washington to Eleanor L. Washington, 1844 April 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Jane Charlotte Blackburn, 1786-1855
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jane C .Washington writes from Blakeley to her daughter-in-law Eleanor Washington at Mount Vernon. Relates ill health of various family members and other family news. Looks forwarding to seeing her granddaughter Louisa, first child of Eleanor and John Augustine Washington III, born several months earlier. With closing sentiments, "I wish you dear daughter ever to feel to & treat me as a mother, by freely calling on me to aid you in any way in which you think I can." Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Elswyth Thane Beebe Collection of Washington Family Papers
